premise: The graph shows two lines: a straight line A representing the U-I graph of a power source and a curved line B representing the U-I graph of a light bulb.
conclusion: The operating point is where the two graphs intersect.

premise: The intersection point is at \\( U = 2 \\) V and \\( I = 2 \\) A.
conclusion: The operating point is at \\( U = 2 \\) V and \\( I = 2 \\) A.

premise: The output power \\( P_{\text{out}} \\) is calculated as \\( U \times I \\).
The total power \\( P_{\text{total}} \\) is also calculated as \\( U \times I \\).

conclusion: The output power and the total power of the power source are both \\( 4 \, \text{W} \\).
